verses.text: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat reigned Abijam over Judah.
Three years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him: and his heart was not perfect with the \sc Lord\sc* his God, as the heart of David his father.
Nevertheless for David’s sake did the \sc Lord\sc* his God give him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem:

because David did \add that\add* which \add was\add* right in the eyes of the \sc Lord\sc*, and turned not aside from any \add thing\add* that he commanded him all the days of his life, save only in the matter of Urijah the Hittite.
And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
Now the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
And Abijam slept with his fathers; and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead.
And in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel reigned Asa over Judah.
And forty and one years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name \add was\add* Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
And Asa did \add that\add* which \add was\add* right in the eyes of the \sc Lord\sc*, as \add did\add* David his father.
And he took away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
And also Maachah his mother, even her he removed from \add being\add* queen, because she had made an idol in a grove; and Asa destroyed her idol, and burnt \add it\add* by the brook Kidron.
But the high places were not removed: nevertheless Asa’s heart was perfect with the \sc Lord\sc* all his days.

And he brought in \add the things\add* which his father had dedicated, and \add the things\add* which himself had dedicated, \add into\add* the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, silver, and gold, and vessels.
And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
And Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that \add he\add* might not suffer \add any\add* to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.

Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, and the treasures of the king’s house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants: and king Asa sent them to Ben-hadad, the son of Tabrimon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,

\add There is\add* a league between me and thee, \add and\add* between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent unto thee a present of silver and gold; come \add and\add* break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.

So Ben-hadad hearkened unto king Asa, and sent the captains of the hosts which he had against the cities of Israel, and smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abel-beth-maachah, and all Cinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
And it came to pass, when Baasha heard \add thereof\add*, that he left off building of Ramah, and dwelt in Tirzah.

Then king Asa made a proclamation throughout all Judah; none \add was\add* exempted: and they took away the stones of Ramah, and the timber thereof, where\add with\add* Baasha had builded; and king Asa built with them Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.

The rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities which he built, \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? Nevertheless in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
And Asa slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead.
And Nadab the son of Jeroboam \add began\add* to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned over Israel two years.
And he did evil in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc*, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.

And Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha smote him at Gibbethon, which \add belongeth\add* to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel laid siege to Gibbethon.
Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah did Baasha slay him, and reigned in his stead.

And it came to pass, when he reigned, \add that\add* he smote all the house of Jeroboam; he left not to Jeroboam any that breathed, until \add he\add* had destroyed him, according unto the saying of the \sc Lord\sc*, which he spake by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite:
because of the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and which he made Israel sin, by his provocation where\add with\add* he provoked the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel to anger.
Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, \add are\add* they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
In the third year of Asa king of Judah \add began\add* Baasha the son of Ahijah to reign over all Israel in Tirzah, twenty and four years.
And he did evil in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc*, and walked in the way of Jeroboam and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
